summary:
• The Taliban's restrictions on women have led to them leading secret online lives.
• Many Afghani women are using social media platforms to communicate with others.
• The Taliban is limiting options for women in Afghanistan.

• A tornado hit a Chinese city, causing debris to fly through the air.
• Scam artists impersonated police officers to deceive people by claiming they were on China's "most wanted" list.

• A singer pays tribute to Ethiopia's traditional female vocalists.
• The singer acknowledges their cultural significance.
• This recognition aims to promote awareness about Ethiopia's rich musical heritage.

• French far-right parties are seeking electoral victories amidst concerns over political gridlock.
• A cyclist was fined for kissing his wife during the Tour de France.
• The far-right movement has gained significant support in France, sparking questions about its potential spread across Europe.

• Viktor Orban visited Moscow
• His trip angered EU allies
• This action upset his European partners

• Masoud Pezeshkian was elected as Iran's president.
• The new president has brought hope to women and younger voters in Iran.
• The newly-elected president will seek to engage with the West.

• Last two migrants on their way to Rwanda get bail.
• Two people found dead in a canal in Dublin.

• At least 16 people killed in air strikes on Gaza schools.
• Israeli-Hamas talks resume, then adjourn due to disagreements.
• Scene of Gaza blast sparks shock and horror among witnesses.

• Japan has largely abandoned floppy disks due to their obsolescence.
• Despite this, some industries continue to use floppy disks in certain contexts.
• This reflects Japan's ongoing reliance on outdated technology.

• Hurricane Beryl hits Mexico's coast
• Storm causes widespread damage to infrastructure and properties
• Emergency services and local authorities work together to respond to the disaster

• The Slovak Prime Minister has made his first public appearance after being shot.
• He was attacked while visiting a town in eastern Slovakia.
• His condition is stable but still recovering from the wound.

• Mass sickness reported in South Korea
• Kimchi suspected as cause
• Investigation underway

• Thousands celebrated the start of the San Fermin Festival in Pamplona.
• The event kicked off with traditional festivities.
• The city was filled with music, dance, and colorful costumes during the celebration.

• An air strike left 100,000 people without power in Ukraine.
• A lorry collided with a minibus, killing 14 people in Ukraine.
• Russia destroyed Ukraine's energy sector; now it is being rebuilt sustainably.

• HMS Diamond returns from Red Sea mission
• UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer meets King and addresses nation
• Keir Starmer leads landslide Labour win, ending 14 years of Tory rule

• Joe Biden's recent interviews have failed to alleviate Democratic concerns about his physical and mental health.
• A malfunctioning firework display caused chaos at a Utah event on Independence Day.
• President Biden acknowledged making mistakes during an interview.
• Wildfires led to evacuations in parts of California.
• A man was sentenced to prison for possessing a replica Zelda sword.
